metadata.title: CVE-2023-23921 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: The vulnerability was found Moodle which exists due to insufficientsanitization of user-supplied data in some returnurl parameters. A remoteattacker can trick the victim to follow a specially crafted link andexecute arbitrary HTML and script code in user's browser in context ofvulnerable website. This flaw allows a remote attacker to performcross-site scripting (XSS) attacks.

criterions.comment: moodle: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
